sn9.3:1.1: At one time Venerable Kassapagotta was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
sn9.3:1.2: Now at that time Venerable Kassapagotta, having withdrawn for his day’s meditation, tried to advise a tribal hunter.
sn9.3:1.3: Then the deity haunting that forest approached Kassapagotta wanting to stir him up, and recited these verses:
sn9.3:2.1: “A tribal hunter wandering the rugged hills
sn9.3:2.3: It’s a waste of time to advise him;
sn9.3:2.4: this mendicant seems to me like an idiot.
sn9.3:3.1: The tribal hunter listens without understanding,
sn9.3:4.1: Even if you lit ten lamps
sn9.3:4.2: and brought them to him, Kassapa,
sn9.3:4.4: for he has no eyes to see.”
sn9.3:5.1: Impelled by that deity, Venerable Kassapagotta was struck with a sense of urgency.
